title: Harper hurt by Dombrowski's doubt in elite status
content: Phillies superstar Bryce Harper said he was "hurt" by Dave Dombrowski's apparent questioning of whether Harper could return to an elite status.

title: Bichette not in Blue Jays' starting lineup for G2
content: After returning from a seven-week absence in Game 1 of the World Series on Friday, Bo Bichette is not in the Toronto Blue Jays' starting lineup for Game 2 on Saturday.

title: Freeze changes QBs, Daniels steers Auburn's win
content: Auburn finally picked up its first victory in Southeastern Conference play, 33-24, over Arkansas Saturday afternoon, as the 4-4 Tigers picked up new life after inserting Ashton Daniels at quarterback late in the second quarter, replacing Jackson Arnold.

title: Sources: Falcons highly likely to start Cousins
content: Kirk Cousins is "highly likely" to be the Falcons' starting quarterback against the Dolphins, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter, as Michael Penix Jr. deals with a bone bruise in his left knee.

title: Liverpool lose again to equal worst-ever Prem run
content: Liverpool matched their worst-ever Premier League run as they sunk to a 3-2 defeat at Brentford on Saturday for their fourth consecutive league loss.

title: Cowboys' Diggs placed on IR, out next 4 games
content: The Cowboys placed cornerback Trevon Diggs on injured reserve Saturday as he continues to deal with concussion symptoms following an accident at his home last week.

title: QB Taylor (knee) ruled out; Fields to start for Jets
content: Jets quarterback Tyrod Taylor has been ruled out against the Bengals with a knee injury, meaning Justin Fields will remain the starter.

title: Packers' Watson activated, may play at Steelers
content: The Green Bay Packers activated Christian Watson, 26, from the physically unable to perform list on Saturday, and the veteran wide receiver could make his season debut on Sunday night against the Pittsburgh Steelers at Acrisure Stadium.

title: UFC 321 results: Eye poke ends Tom Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane fight
content: Live results from UFC 321 card, including a main event between Tom Aspinall and Ciryl Gane that ended in no contest.

title: Inside the celebration at Rogers Centre as Toronto made its case
content: On a night Toronto had been waiting for for decades, the Blue Jays showed they're more than ready for their moment.

title: X-ray tables, marked cards and the Mafia: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: Details of how poker games, some involving Chauncey Billups, were allegedly rigged to make people lose big.

title: Catch up with our last-minute predictions, fantasy sleepers, more
content: Big game for Derrick Henry? Alec Pierce's first TD of the season? More fantasy upside for Joe Flacco? Here's what to know for Week 8.

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' highlights: McIntyre heats up title match against Rhodes
content: Friday's "SmackDown" set up a perfect "Saturday Night's Main Event," with Drew McIntyre and Cody Rhodes ready for the challenge.

title: Last-minute pickups: Bucs duo of Tez Johnson, Cade Otton among top Week 8 options
content: If this heavy bye week or injuries have you seeking lineup help, we have available options to consider.

title: Mbappé vs. Yamal is the new Ronaldo vs. Messi -- so which Clasico star is better?
content: Not since Messi vs. Ronaldo has the Barcelona-Real Madrid rivalry given us a matchup like Yamal vs. Mbappe. So, which superstar would you rather have?

title: Madrid vs. Barça head-to-head, form, key clashes, predictions, odds
content: When Real Madrid and Barcelona face off, there's nothing bigger happening anywhere in the soccer world.

title: NFC East roundtable: Can the defending champs take the division crown again?
content: So far, every team in the NFC East except the Eagles has played three division games. Here's how they stack up.

title: Giants-Eagles rivalry and the punt that lives in NFL infamy
content: DeSean Jackson and Matt Dodge relive a 15-year-old shank and a walk-off return that fans will never forget.

title: Shock USWNT loss shows lack of problem-solving, but no cause for alarm (yet)
content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

title: Piastri: Norris & I have 'clean slate' in Mexico
content: Oscar Piastri has confirmed that he and McLaren teammate Lando Norris are starting from a "clean slate" at the Mexican Grand Prix after the Australian took responsibility for their collision at the U.S. Grand Prix.

title: NBA intel: Wemby's new game plan, and early concerns for Lakers and Rockets
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst take the pulse of the league after a thrilling first few nights of 2025-26.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United optimistic over Hjulmand deal
content: Manchester United are optimistic they can secure a deal to sign Sporting CP midfielder Morten Hjulmand. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: West Bengal BJP urges Bangladeshi Hindu refugees to apply for citizenship under CAA ahead of 2026 polls
content: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar said the party’s fight for 2026 is of “aar-paar” (two sides of a border). The statement assumes significance in light of the stark differentiation the saffron party has made between ‘infiltrators’ and ‘refugees’ from neighbouring countries, in the context of voter list revision and CAA camps respectively

title: Mehbooba moves PIL plea to shift J&K undertrials home
content: The former Chief Minister has approached the J&K High Court seeking the return of undertrial prisoners lodged in jails outside the Union Territory, citing violations of their right to fair trial and family access

title: Nearly 2,000 irrigation tanks in Tamil Nadu going beyond 75% storage
content: With the monsoon expected to yield higher rainfall this year, many more tanks may touch full level in the coming weeks

title: Portion of concrete ceiling of Tower C at Chander Kunj apartments collapses
content: Large chunk of concrete on the roof of ground floor lobby collapsed in the early hours of Saturday; only one resident still stays in the tower as his advance rent from AWHO is yet to be released

title: Disappointed with Minister Duraimurugan’s remarks on Chembarambakkam lake issue, says Selvaperunthagai
content: This follows a video that has been doing the rounds in which the Congress leader is seen chiding a Water Resources Department official for not informing him about the event of water release

title: Will concentrate on strengthening PMK at grassroots level, says Srikanthi Parasuraman
content: She says she will work to fulfill the aspirations of Dr. Ramadoss in party development activities under his guidance

title: Have ‘green’ crackers brought down pollution? | Explained
content: Is ‘reduced emission fireworks’ a better term to describe such ‘green’ crackers? Who developed these fireworks?

title: Kurnool bus tragedy: petrol, mobile phones, gas cylinder and inflammable material caused inferno
content: Emergency exits, cabin and main doors of the bus did not open, denying any chance to the passengers to escape from the bus, says DG of A.P. State Disaster Response and Fire Services Department

title: Tejashwi Yadav claims liquor ban in Bihar is in name only
content: He also alleged that male police officers conduct raids without women constables in the houses of the poor when the women are there with the family

title: More amoebic meningoencephalitis cases reported in Kerala
content: Thiruvananthapuram continues to have the highest number of amoebic infection cases, with 47 cases and six deaths so far

title: Samagra Shiksha partners with NGO for holistic education of adolescent girls
content: The programme aims to conduct structured workshops and awareness sessions for girl students from Classes 6 to 10 on menstrual hygiene management, health, wellbeing and personal safety

title: Nitish urges Muslims to vote, days after Giriraj Singh’s controversial remarks
content: The Bihar Chief Minister sought votes from Muslims days after BJP Union Minister Giriraj Singh referred to them as ‘namak haram’ (traitors); he listed his government’s initiatives for the Muslim community, and alleged previous governments had neglected them

title: Infant dies near Ambur after house wall collapses
content: Police admitted the child at Government Taluk Hospital in Ambur town before she was referred to Government Medical College Hospital in Vellore where she later died.

title: Centre, T.N. government should work together on paddy procurement: Union Minister
content: The Minister was here as part of the ongoing Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan, a nationwide campaign that celebrates India’s progress in agriculture

title: Invalid votes, cross-voting pulled NC’s vote share down in each round of the J&K Rajya Sabha poll
content: There was one invalid vote in the first round, two in the second, and three in the third; with three candidates in the fray in the third round, the BJP managed one win, as cross-voting doomed the NC

title: Vellore GH celebrates International Day for Older Persons
content: According to a press release, this year’s theme is ‘Older Persons Driving Local and Global Action: Our Aspirations, Our Well-Being and Our Rights.’

title: Power demand in State expected to exceed 19,000 MW by 2026: Navin Mittal
content: Instructs Chief Engineers and Superintending Engineers to complete all planned line repairs, installation of new transformers and other developmental works by December

title: Israel Conducts Strike Targeting Islamic Jihad Member In Gaza
content: The Israeli military said on Saturday that it conducted an air strike targeting an alleged Islamic Jihad militant in central Gaza, despite a ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump.

title: Video: Karnataka Ex-MLA Gored During Bull Race Festival
content: A former MLA in Karnataka's Shivamogga district was injured after being gored by a bull during a traditional bull race festival - Hori Habba.

title: Woman Leaves Mid-Argument, Her Husband Slits Their Twin Daughters' Throats
content: A man in Maharashtra quarrelled with his wife. As soon as the woman left for her parents' home during the argument, the man took his two-year-old twin daughters to a forested area, slit their throats.

title: Cop Accused Of Raping Maharashtra Doctor Who Died By Suicide Arrested
content: Police sub-inspector Gopal Badane, an accused in the alleged suicide of a woman government doctor in Maharashtra's Satara district, was arrested on Saturday evening hours after a co-accused had been nabbed.

title: "I Am Not Done": Kamala Harris To Run For US President Again
content: Kamala Harris said she expects a woman will be president in the coming years, and it could "possibly" be her.

title: Man, 55, Dies After Being Run Over By Rashly Driven Thar In Uttarakhand
content: A 55-year-old man was killed Saturday morning after being hit by a speeding Thar in Uttarakhand's Haldwani, police said.

title: "I'm Safe In Imphal": Thadou Tribe Leader's Message Of Peace In Manipur
content: A young leader of the Thadou tribe has been living in Manipur's Imphal valley for the last one month and sharing updates from the city to demolish what he called a deliberate narrative of fear-mongering.

title: Video: No Bridge, Odisha Villagers Use Rope, Metal Pot To Cross River
content: Tribal villagers in Kadamaha village in Odisha's Kandhamal district risk their lives every day to cross a river due to the lack of a bridge and proper connectivity.

title: Class 11 Student Rescued After Teenagers Attempt Gunpoint Kidnapping In Delhi
content: A group of teenagers allegedly tried to abduct a Class 11 student at gunpoint from outside a private school in South Delhi's Greater Kailash area following a quarrel between two groups of students, police said on Saturday.

title: In Doctor Suicide Case, Father's Death Penalty Appeal To Devendra Fadnavis
content: The father of the 26-year-old doctor who died by suicide in Maharashtra's Satara has sought the death penalty for the culprits responsible for her daughter's death.

title: 24-Year-Old NEET Aspirant Found Dead In Hostel Room In Kota
content: A 24-year-old NEET aspirant from Odisha was found dead in his hostel room in Rajiv Gandhi Nagar on Saturday, police said.

title: 'Boost For Local Artistes Too': J&K Lt Governor To NDTV Good Times On Sonu Nigam Concert
content: NDTV Good Times has reached Jammu and Kashmir with a massive star-studded concert where Sonu Nigam will perform.

title: 'True Legend Of Indian Entertainment': PM Modi On Satish Shah
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that late actor Satish Shah will be remembered as 'the a true legend of Indian entertainment.'

title: Pregnant Woman Dies 6 Months After Wedding, Family Alleges Dowry Harassment
content: A pregnant woman has died under mysterious circumstances in Rajasthan's Tonk district, police said on Saturday.

title: Woman Said Mother-In-Law Can't Stay With Them, Faridabad Man Kills Himself
content: A radiotherapist allegedly died by suicide by jumping from the 15th floor of a residential building where he was staying with his family in Greater Faridabad area, police said on Saturday.

title: In This Bihar Seat, NDA Leaders Extend Support To Independent Candidate
content: NDA leaders in Bihar have pledged support to an Independent candidate in the Marhaura assembly constituency Saran district in the absence of the alliance's own representation on the seat.

title: Woman's Body Found Wrapped In Bedsheet Inside Auto In Bengaluru
content: A woman was found dead inside an autorickshaw in Bengaluru's Tilaknagar area on Saturday. The victim was identified as 35-years-old Salma. Her body was discovered in an autorickshaw parked on the main road in Tilaknagar.

title: Accused Cop On The Run, Devendra Fadnavis Orders Swift Action In Doctor Suicide Case
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday assured that no one involved in the alleged abetment of the suicide of a woman doctor in Satara will be spared, asserting that the matter is "serious" and needs a thorough probe.

title: 'India's Name Sullied': Australian Cricketers' Molestation Sparks Political Row
content: Two cricketers from the Australian women's national team were inappropriately touched by a man on a motorcycle in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday morning.

title: After Centre, States To Switch To "Swadeshi Platform" Zoho Mail
content: A number of state governments are now going to shift their official email infrastructure to Zoho Mail, on the heels of the recent switch by the central government from the National Informatics Centre platform

title: Sharp decline in complaints received by Lokpal
content: The data available on the Lokpal’s website reveals that the Lokpal has ordered preliminary inquiries in only 289 cases against all the complaints it has received till now

title: Consumer group accuses Hescom of misusing review to hike tariffs
content: The Balakedarara Hitarakshaka Sangha, led by its president G.G. Hegde Kadekodi, filed the objection before the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission. The group has opined that Hescom’s review petition is ‘not maintainable in law’ and ‘an appeal in disguise’.

title: Vigyan Shri winner from Kerala has his sight set on Next Gen Launch Vehicle
content: Jayan N., project director of NGLV at the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre, wins the award in the Space Science and Technology category for his contributions to developing cryogenic engines

title: Rice institute issues field-ready flood management advice for samba, thaladi
content: Excess water should be drained without delay and completely damaged patches be gap-filled with seedlings of the same variety where possible: K. Subrahmaniyan, TRRI Director

title: Watch: Why a young woman doctor’s alleged suicide points to a deeper systemic rot in Maharashtra
content: Recently, a young woman doctor allegedly died by suicide in Maharashtra’s Satara district. One of the two prime suspects, a police officer allegedly named as a rapist, is absconding.

title: Ensure milk, eggs are supplied in prescribed quantity in anganwadis, says SHRC
content: Directive to Women and Child Development dept. director to enforce guidelines issued for effective implementation of Poshaka Balyam in anganwadis

title: Railway Protection Force steps up video surveillance on general coaches
content: ‘The primary objective of the move is to deter people who board trains with criminal intentions from committing offences’

title: Centre announces Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar for scientific achievements
content: Physicist Jayant Narlikar, who passed away earlier this year, will be conferred Vigyan Ratna posthumously

title: Amit Shah seeks the blessings of Bihar voters for another five years
content: He also wishes the people on the State’s biggest festival, the ‘Chhath’, that began with Nahay Khay on October 25.

title: Procurement of paddy is on in full swing across Delta districts, say officials
content: Tiruvarur, Mayiladuthurai, and Nagpattinam districts alone have accounted for procurement of  3,98,636 tonnes with a total of ₹970.74 crore paid to bank accounts of 66,245 farmers

title: As Cyclone Montha looms, IMD issues alerts for Andhra Pradesh
content: Red alert has been issued for at least 12 districts on October 28 and 29; the well-marked low-pressure area is likely to intensify into a deep depression by October 26 and into a cyclonic storm  by October 27, and then into a severe cyclonic storm by October 28 and cross the Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam, says the weatherman

title: Bihar election: Woman’s identity is often tied to her male relative, says CPI(ML)’s Digha candidate Divya Gautam
content: Her connection to deceased actor Sushant Singh Rajput, who was her cousin, has become a talking point. Ms. Gautam, a theatre actor and PhD scholar of gender studies hopes that the narrative will soon turn to her work

title: Families of Indians stuck in Russian warzone say they last heard from them 50-days ago
content: At least two Indians have been killed in the Russia-Ukraine war since September, and the body of one of them arrived from Russia on October 18; the MEA had said previously that it had taken up the matter with Russian authorities and insisted that the practice of recruiting Indians in the war be ended and that ‘our nationals be released’

title: Tensions mount in Aligarh over religious slogan written on temple walls
content: Local police register case against 7 people in some villages of the U.P. district; right-wing activists demand action against culprits

title: PM SHRI won’t alter curriculum of Kerala schools: Minister
content: PM SHRI agreement signed to utilise Central funds for improving physical infrastructure of schools and not to surrender the State’s syllabus to the Union government, says Sivankutty.

title: Collector urges officials to enforce road safety rules, identify accident-prone areas
content: Between January and September this year, 429 road accidents occurred in the Sri Sathya Sai district, resulting in 255 casualties and 483 injuries, says Shyam Prasad

title: Government will take steps to protect conventional media amid digital disruption: I&B Minister
content: The Registrar of Newspapers for India, the Press Information Bureau, and the Central Bureau of Communication would soon be integrated for efficient coordination and convergence across media outreach and regulatory functions, Ashwini Vaishnaw said

title: Bihar’s Gaura-Bauram goes to VIP in last minute seat-sharing deal, RJD candidate refuses to withdraw
content: Confusion reigned over the ‘bizarre situation for voters’, with the RJD’s Afzal Ali Khan refusing to step aside for Santosh Sahani, younger brother of Vikassheel Insaan Party founder Mukesh Sahani

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Festive season sees 1.5 crore passengers, may cross 2.5 crore, says Railway Minister
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Trinamool leadership slams BJP over atrocities against women in BJP-ruled States
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Bihar polls: Early sunset for Jan Suraaj? 3 key battles facing the 'challenger'
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj party faces significant hurdles in Bihar's upcoming elections. Candidate desertions and worker discontent plague the new political force. Both ruling alliances and opposition accuse Jan Suraaj of being a 'B team,' raising questions about its electoral viability and potential to act as a spoiler.

title: Justice Surya Kant poised to be next CJI: Landmark verdicts; humble start
content: Justice Surya Kant, the most senior Supreme Court judge, is set to become the Chief Justice of India next month. Hailing from a humble village in Haryana, his journey to the nation's highest judicial office is marked by perseverance and dedication. He will be the first Haryanvi to hold this prestigious position.

title: Rashtriya Ekta Diwas: PM Modi to witness ‘desi’ dog squads; canines trained by BSF
content: Indian breed dogs like Mudhol and Rampur Hounds, once championed by Prime Minister Modi, will march at the Rashtriya Ekta Diwas parade. These resilient 'desi' dogs, trained by the BSF, have proven effective in various operations, showcasing their agility and adaptability to Indian conditions.

title: Kotak Mahindra consolidated net profit for Q2FY26 drops by 11%; at Rs 4,468 cr - details
content: Kotak Mahindra Bank's consolidated net profit for Q2FY26 saw an 11% decline due to higher provisions, despite continued credit and deposit growth. CEO Ashok Vaswani remained non-committal on reports of interest in acquiring IDBI Bank, emphasizing the bank's focus on scaling through both organic and inorganic avenues. The bank evaluates opportunities based on strategic fit, management bandwidth, and financial valuations.

title: ‘13,000x faster’: Sundar Pichai hails ‘verifiable quantum edge’; Elon Musk reacts
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Maharashtra doctor suicide case: Policeman arrested; accused of rape and abetment
content: Police have arrested sub-inspector Gopal Badane, the second accused in the suicide case of a woman doctor from Satara, Maharashtra. This arrest follows closely on the heels of the apprehension of Prashant Bankar, the landlord's son and a co-accused. Bankar has been remanded to four days of police custody.

title: 'Exposure to Adani much less than to other groups': Officials on LIC; question US report timing
content: Government officials have denied allegations of influencing LIC's investment decisions, stating the insurer's board-approved policies govern its investments. They emphasized LIC's exposure to the Adani Group is significantly less than to other major conglomerates like Tata and Reliance, with investments subject to regulatory oversight.

title: RS poll: NC denies ‘match fixing’ charge; Omar refuses to reveal who cross-voted for BJP
content: Political tensions escalated in Kashmir after the BJP secured a Rajya Sabha seat with support from legislators outside the party. While National Conference leadership denied cross-voting allegations, party president Farooq Abdullah revealed the BJP had approached them for a seat prior to the polls, a claim refuted by Sajad Lone.

title: ‘Patently excessive’: JP Morgan fumes as it foots $60 m bill for founder; calls fees ‘abuse’
content: JPMorgan Chase is reportedly seeking to end its obligation to pay legal fees for Charlie Javice, the founder of Frank, who was found guilty of defrauding the bank. Despite a contract clause, JPMorgan argues the $60.1 million already advanced for her defense and appeal is "patently excessive and egregious," citing multiple law firms and high hourly rates.

title: Blake Lively–Justin Baldoni legal drama shifts as Swift, Kelce stay away
content: Blake Lively's legal battle with Justin Baldoni has reportedly strained her friendship with Taylor Swift. Lively's legal team accuses Baldoni of withholding evidence, while Swift has remained distant. Sources suggest Lively fears the fallout could impact her and Ryan Reynolds' careers, as Swift's influence in Hollywood is immense.

title: ‘Unforeseen factors rising’: Xi sounds alarm – key challenges loom as China sets 5-yr plan
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping warned of rising uncertainties as the Communist Party approved its next five-year plan, emphasizing technological innovation and economic restructuring. The blueprint, personally shaped by Xi, aims to strengthen China's domestic market and "real economy" amidst global volatility and domestic headwinds.

title: ‘Not robust enough’: Airbnb CEO says ChatGPT can’t yet power platform; hints at future use
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.

title: Canada visa crisis: Refusal rate crosses 50%; court filings skyrocket - what's going on?
content: Canada's immigration system is experiencing an unprecedented surge in visa and permit refusals, leading to widespread concerns about automated decision-making replacing human assessment. This crisis is fueling a significant rise in judicial reviews as applicants challenge decisions deemed generic and unreasonable, with numbers of new temporary residents, particularly students, declining sharply.

title: Hospital reveals Satish Shah was found unresponsive at home; last rites to be held tomorrow
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, known for his unforgettable performances in Sarabhai vs Sarabhai and Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro, passed away at the age of 74 on October 25. The actor, who had reportedly been unwell for the past few months, breathed his last due to kidney failure.

title: UFC 321 Abu Dhabi: Aspinall vs Gane title fight — time, where to watch, results
content: UFC 321 is live from Abu Dhabi, featuring Tom Aspinall defending his heavyweight title against Ciryl Gane and Mackenzie Dern challenging for the strawweight belt. The stacked card includes other exciting matchups, with fans worldwide tuning in for the championship bouts. The event continues to showcase UFC's global reach and fan engagement.

title: Cardi B opens up on Offset marriage regrets during pregnancy with Diggs
content: Cardi B is preparing to welcome her fourth child with Stefon Diggs while navigating a difficult divorce from Offset. She recently expressed her wish for Offset to be a better person for their children, acknowledging his past infidelity. Offset has since admitted to cheating, taking responsibility for his "bad decisions."

title: Keeping legends sharp! How Shubman plans to manage Rohit & Virat's ODI rhythm
content: Skipper Shubman Gill emphasised the need for careful management of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, now playing only one format, to ensure they maintain game time.  He praised their match-winning performances, calling their clinical chase a "treat to watch" and a "great bonus" for the team, highlighting their technical brilliance and ability to finish games.

title: Ayesha Curry surprises fans with custom warriors gift amid divorce rumors
content: Stephen Curry kicked off the NBA season with a stellar performance, leading the Warriors to victory. Meanwhile, his wife Ayesha received a unique, custom-designed Warriors jersey from Kristin Juszczyk. Ayesha's social media posts, including one referencing "Year 17," sparked fan confusion, while recent divorce rumors were debunked, with Ayesha clarifying her past views on marriage and motherhood.

title: Chet Holmgren injury update: OKC Thunder star cleared to play vs Hawk
content: Chet Holmgren is questionable for the Oklahoma City Thunder's game against the Atlanta Hawks on October 25, 2025, due to lower back soreness. The young star's availability is a game-time decision, impacting the Thunder's undefeated start and defensive capabilities. His absence would force lineup adjustments and place more offensive burden on Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: Af-Pak conflict: Islamabad warns Kabul of 'open war'; peace talks under way
content: Pakistan's defence Minister warned of potential "open war" with Afghanistan if ongoing Istanbul talks fail to secure a lasting peace agreement. The discussions follow deadly border clashes, with both nations seeking to prevent a relapse into violence after the Taliban's 2021 takeover. An immediate ceasefire was reportedly agreed upon, but tensions remain high.

title: Nod of the head and a warm hug - How Rohit & Virat gave fans goosebumps
content: Rohit Sharma's 50th international century, a remarkable 33rd in ODIs, was a testament to his enduring class and resilience. Partnering with Virat Kohli, he anchored India's chase with an unbeaten 121, securing a memorable win. This historic feat, coupled with strong bowling, showcased India's dominance and the enduring magic of their batting stalwarts.

title: Zinc and immunity: Why low zinc keeps you sick and tired - simple food fixes that work
content: Zinc supports your immune system, hormones, skin, and energy levels. Yet mild deficiency is common in India, making people fall sick often or feel unusually tired. Here’s how to recognise it and fix it naturally.

title: Satara suicide case: CM Fadnavis vows strict action; warns against 'politicising issue'
content: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis has promised swift action regarding the suicide of a woman doctor in Satara. He stated that police officials involved have been suspended and arrests are being made. The doctor died by suicide on Friday, leaving a note on her hand naming two individuals, including a police official. Relatives allege pressure for incorrect post-mortem reports.

title: Rana 'ignores' Gill, listens to Rohit Sharma; picks up a wicket moments later
content: Pacer Harshit Rana shared a humorous on-field chat with Shubman Gill and Rohit Sharma during India's ODI win against Australia. Rana dismissed Mitchell Owen after a playful exchange about field placements, highlighting Rohit's experienced advice. This moment highlighted Rohit's value to the team as India secured a dominant nine-wicket victory.

title: Dan Clancy on Twitch’s failure After Emiru’s assault: Safety concerns grow
content: Twitch CEO Dan Clancy admitted the platform "failed" after streamer Emiru was assaulted at TwitchCon, taking full responsibility for the incident and a "mismanaged" response.  Emiru reported staff inaction and a false initial statement from Twitch.  Clancy confirmed a comprehensive review of event safety and security protocols is underway to better protect creators and fans.

title: Why Vitamin C isn't just for colds: How it protects your skin, heart, and brain
content: Vitamin C does more than boost immunity. From protecting your heart and skin to slowing ageing, this essential nutrient works as a powerful antioxidant that many people still don’t get enough of.

title: 'Few more kilos down...' - Abhishek Nayar reveals Rohit is on a weight-loss mission
content: Rohit Sharma, after a match-winning century in Sydney, hinted that this might be his and Virat Kohli's final tour of Australia. Sharma's unbeaten 121 marked his 50th international century and third-highest ODI run tally for India. His resurgence is attributed to three months of dedicated training and a strict fitness regime.

title: Pak’s economy collapsing? Public debt rises to $286.8 bn; debt-to-GDP ratio hits 70%
content: Pakistan's public debt surged to $286.832 billion by June 2025, a nearly 13% increase from the previous year, pushing the debt-to-GDP ratio to 70%. This rise is attributed to lower-than-expected GDP growth and subdued inflation. Despite these challenges, the economy shows signs of recovery with IMF support and improved external reserves.

title: 'You can call me Raja': Indian-origin Congressman shuts down 'racist' Florida leader
content: Chandler Langevin is a member of the Palm Bay City Council who made headlines because of his hateful statements against Indians. He said Indians in America only care for benefiting their countries and hence they should be ousted. This led to a massive controversy and the city council voted for the elimination of Langevin from the council.

title: Satish Shah remembered late Shammi Kapoor in his last tweet
content: Satish Shah, known for his role in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', passed away at 74 due to kidney failure. His last tweet was a tribute to Shammi Kapoor, prompting fans to offer condolences and draw parallels between the two actors' legacies. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also expressed his grief.

title: Happy Chhath Puja 2025: Wishes, messages, quotes & images
content: Chhath Puja, a sacred and eco-friendly festival dedicated to Surya Dev and Chhathi Maiya, will be celebrated from October 25-28, 2025. This four-day observance, prominent in Bihar, Jharkhand, and Uttar Pradesh, involves rituals like Nahay Khay, Kharna, Sandhya Arghya, and Usha Arghya.

title: When will Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma play next for India?
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli ended India's Australia tour with a dominant nine-wicket win, with Rohit scoring an unbeaten 121 and Kohli 74 not out in the 3rd ODI. Despite their stellar performance, questions linger about their future in the 50-over format, with their next ODI appearance anticipated in the home series against South Africa.

title: Nina Lin and Zoe Spencer banned from Twitch over assault allegations
content: Twitch has banned popular streamers Nina Lin and Zoe Spencer following a viral video allegedly showing them assaulting FaZe Silky's assistant. The footage, which circulated widely, depicted inappropriate actions leading to immediate backlash. Lin has since apologized, admitting her conduct was wrong, while Spencer has remained silent. The platform's swift action has sparked debate online.

title: Trade, Xi & Kim: Trump starts Asia tour; what's on the agenda
content: President Trump begins his first Asia tour of his second term, visiting Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea. The trip aims to restore economic balance and reaffirm US influence, with key meetings planned with Chinese President Xi Jinping and potentially North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.  The tour includes trade negotiations, peace accords, and investment commitments.

title: 'Gharwale bhi bol rahe hai ...' - Why Gill gave this reply during PC
content: India's 18-match ODI toss losing streak continued as Australia won the toss and batted first. Captain Gill light-heartedly addressed the streak, emphasising the team's confident, no-pressure environment. He also praised Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's match-winning partnership in India's nine-wicket victory.

title: 'True legend': PM Modi mourns veteran actor Satish Shah; hails 'iconic wit'
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, a legend of Indian entertainment, has passed away at 74. Known for his iconic roles in films like 'Jaane Bhi Do Yaaro' and the beloved TV show 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', Shah brought laughter to millions with his impeccable comic timing and versatility.

title: Jharkhand shock: 7-yr-old tests HIV+, kin blame blood bank; probe underway
content: A seven-year-old thalassemia patient in Jharkhand has tested HIV-positive, leading to an investigation into allegations of contaminated blood transfusion from the local blood bank. A five-member team from Ranchi is probing the incident, examining blood donors and the blood bank's procedures. While the family suspects the blood bank, authorities caution against premature conclusions, noting other potential infection routes.

title: BCCI breaks silence after Australia Women cricketers molested in Indore
content: Two Australian cricketers faced inappropriate behaviour in Indore, prompting a strong condemnation from the BCCI. The accused motorcyclist was swiftly arrested by local police. The BCCI Secretary emphasized India's hospitality and zero tolerance for such acts, assuring a review of safety protocols to protect visiting teams. The incident occurred near the players' hotel.

title: J&K: GRP Constable's rifle goes off accidentally; critical
content:
Representational Image

JAMMU: A 37-year-old GRP constable sustained critical injuries to his abdomen after his service rifle went off accidentally at Jammu railway station Saturday morning. “Shokat Ahmed, from Anantnag and posted with govt railway police in Jammu, was rushed to Govt Medical College and Hospital by his colleagues... An inquiry has been initiated to ascertain the exact cause and circumstances leading to the incident,” an official said.

End of Article

title: 'Not an unlawful assembly: Madras HC on Ram Temple telecast; quashes FIR against 5
content:
Madras HC

CHENNAI: Madras HC quashed an FIR against five men accused of creating public disturbance in Coimbatore while watching live telecast of the Ram Lalla consecration event at the Ayodhya temple last year, ruling that gathering for a religious event cannot be treated as an unlawful assembly, reports Sureshkumar K. Justice N Sathish Kumar said the prosecution's materials did not show that the accused used criminal force, committed any offence, or interfered with anyone's rights. According to the complaint, the men had installed an LED screen outside a temple to stream the event, allegedly causing traffic congestion. The high court held there were no specific allegations or evidence to support charges, observing that gatherings for religious functions cannot be criminalised merely because some groups raise grievances.

End of Article
